abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Public Financial Management
            Project for Colombia has two developmental aims. It
            strengthens the capacity of the Direccion de Impuestos y
            Aduanas Nacionales (Directorate of National Taxes and
            Customs)(DIAN) to foster voluntary compliance; collects
            revenues efficiently, effectively, and equitably; and
            combats tax evasion and smuggling, for the DIAN to mobilize
            adequate tax revenues to finance public expenditures. It
            also aims to strengthen public expenditure management at the
            central government level, to facilitate achievement of
            fiscal and national development objectives, improve cost
            effectiveness of public services, and increase transparency
            and accountability. The project has two main components:
            revenue administration and public expenditure. The first
            component comprises six sub-components which strengthen
            organization and management of the DIAN; facilitate
            voluntary compliance; improve the effectiveness of the DIAN
            in managing routine processing of tax declarations and
            payments, and cargo, customs declarations, and payments;
            strengthen the capacity of the DIAN in enforcement
            operations; and improve policy and the legal framework of
            revenue administration. The second component comprises three
            sub-components that improve macro-programming and
            formulation and monitoring of the budget; strengthen budget
            execution, treasury, and public credit and accounting;
            improve the evaluation of results of public expenditure; and
            strengthen public procurement and contracting.
